review_title: RVH review as a social worker
pros: Great place to work, good people
cons: Competitive place to try and be hired into

pros: They have some really great management and policies. Good union involvement. Good team work on most of the units. Great patient population. Relatively good patient ratios. Usually good staffing levels...big float nurse department. I like their new mission and goals and the changes they have made as a result over the past few years in the work culture. They do extensive employee surveys every year or two and actually respond to employee suggestions. Lots of education opportunities. They have interest free computer and education loans...or they will just pay for your education. Love Kronos - online access to the scheduling program from work or home. Some great doctors. New - regional cancer centre and developing regional involvement in nephritis and cardiology. Lots of new opportunities coming up in the next few years.
cons: Staffing department can be lame. A few bad experiences with one manager. Sometimes they get hung up on enforcing stupid policies that take up more time than we have. There have been some changes that resulted in loss of positions but those people still had jobs...just in other parts of the hospitals (2016 added PSWs to some units and displaced some nurses)

pros: I have a great team, and they are all very supportive and understanding. The pay is pretty good and things have generally been good pre-Covid.
cons: No full-time opportunities for me because lack of funding. No benefits for part-time staff. During this pandemic, doing 12-hr shifts have gotten worse. I am still stuck not knowing when I will be back at my department. No proper breaks and always understaffed, especially during the night shifts. Lack of empathy from leaders, especially when one has never done night shifts until covid hit.

job_title: Patient Service Clerk in Barrie, ON
pros: Very good hospital to work at. I worked there for six years. I worked  directly with cancer patients.  Those patients made  me love my job even more.
cons: Working with some teams were a little more challenging than others. But it came down to the quality of the manager in charge who would take over difficult teams and made them better.

pros: Good benefits, like other hospitals.
cons:
ClaimSecure is a terrible insurance agency that we have to go through for our benefits. I had to call several times and email in order to be reimbursed for my massage and physiotherapy when all documents were present. 

Poor management in many floors  - expect way too much out of us.

pros:
- Open to change and adding technology
- Excellent interdisciplinary teams
- Electronic documentation
cons:
- Poor management and poor training for those in leadership roles (i.e.charge nurses)
- Lack of educational opportunities and supports
- Heavy patient to nurse ratios (5:1)
- Difficulty seeking compensation for working overtime

pros: Work culture is beyond positive and encouraging. Management works with employees to make sure patient care is efficient. I love love love working at this hospital!
cons: The one and only challenge of working here is the location. When Barrie and the surrounding area gets hit with a snowstorm, the drive is sometimes gruelling.

review_title: RVH is a great place to work
pros: Pays a premium for most jobs compared to other locations down South, while still offering excellent benefits. Work environment is also great and everyone's super friendly.
cons: Barrie is a little North, however that may be a pro due to a quieter residential area and lower costs of living.
